revised_title: Behavior of Adsorbed Helium at Low Temperatures and Lateral Migration
tldr: This article explores the behavior of helium atoms adsorbed on solid surfaces at low temperatures. The authors construct a map of the potential field between the crystal surface and the helium atom, and use this information to understand the energy levels and wave functions of the adsorbed helium. They also study the lateral migration of helium atoms in the adsorbed state, finding that even at low energies, migration occurs due to the periodic nature of the surface field.
